name: Sklearn Bayesian Ridge Regression
description: Bayesian regression allows a natural mechanism to survive insufficient data or poorly distributed data by formulating linear regression using probability distributors rather than point estimates. The output or response ‘y’ is assumed to drawn from a probability distribution rather than estimated as a single value.

fields.name: targetCol
fields.title: Target Column
fields.description: The label column for model fitting

fields.name: featureCols
fields.title: Feature Columns
fields.description: Feature columns of type - all numeric, boolean and vector

fields.name: niter
fields.title: Number of Iterations
fields.description: Maximum number of iterations. Should be greater than or equal to 1.

fields.name: alpha1
fields.title: Alpha1
fields.description: Hyper-parameter : shape parameter for the Gamma distribution prior over the alpha parameter.

fields.name: alpha2
fields.title: Alpha2
fields.description: Hyper-parameter : inverse scale parameter (rate parameter) for the Gamma distribution prior over the alpha parameter.

fields.name: lambda1
fields.title: Lambda1
fields.description: Hyper-parameter : shape parameter for the Gamma distribution prior over the lambda parameter.

fields.name: lambda2
fields.title: Lambda2
fields.description: Hyper-parameter : inverse scale parameter (rate parameter) for the Gamma distribution prior over the lambda parameter.

fields.name: tol
fields.title: Tolerance
fields.description: Stop the algorithm if w has converged

fields.name: fitintercept
fields.title: Fit Intercept
fields.description: Whether to calculate the intercept for this model. The intercept is not treated as a probabilistic parameter and thus has no associated variance. If set to False, no intercept will be used in calculations

fields.name: normalize
fields.title: Normalize
fields.description: This parameter is ignored when ``fit_intercept`` is set to False. If True, the regressors X will be normalized before regression by subtracting the mean and dividing by the l2-norm.

fields.name: compute_score
fields.title: Compute Score
fields.description: If True, compute the log marginal likelihood at each iteration of the optimization.
